Previously limited to Pixel Buds, the feature will soon expand globally and to iOS by 2026. This advancement allows more natural and accurate translations by preserving tone, emphasis, and cadence, enhancing understandability in real-time conversations, lectures, and media in over 70 languages.

The upgrade leverages Google‚Äôs Gemini AI, which improves translation of slang, idioms, and expressions by interpreting contextual meanings‚Äîfor example, accurately translating idioms like ‚Äústealing my thunder.‚Äù Additionally, Google has improved its built-in language learning tools, offering personalized pronunciation feedback, usage tips, and progress tracking features. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Previously limited to Google's Pixel Buds, this capability is now available in beta to users with the Google Translate app in the U.S., Mexico, and India. By tapping the \"Live translate\" button with headphones paired, users can access live, one-way voice translations supporting over 70 languages. This allows users to engage in conversations, listen to lectures, or watch shows in foreign languages with real-time translation delivered through their headphones.\n\nThe update also enhances text translations by leveraging AI to better understand tone, emphasis, idioms, and slang, improving naturalness and accuracy. Currently launched with support for nearly 20 languages, these improvements aim to make translation more intuitive and effective. response_text: Yes ‚Äî there are real-time audio-to-text and translation solutions that can convert spoken words into written text (and often translated text) as you speak. Google Play+1 [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?hl=en_US&id=com.erudite.translator]  üîπ Live Audio ‚Üí Text (Speech-to-Text)  Google Live Transcribe ‚Äì Android app that captions speech in real time. Wikipedia [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Live_Transcribe]  Speechlogger ‚Äì Web service that provides live transcriptions and can translate them. speechlogger.com [https://speechlogger.com/]  Otter.ai ‚Äì Real-time transcription in meetings/calls. Otter.ai [https://otter.ai/]  üîπ Real-Time Translation (Speech-to-Text + Translation)  Maestra/Palabra/Wordly/JotMe/Transync AI ‚Äì AI tools that transcribe and translate speech in real time for meetings, conversations, or live events. ÂêåË®ÄÁøªËØë+4live.maestra.ai+4palabra.ai+4 [https://live.maestra.ai/]  Instant Voice Translate / iTranslate Voice ‚Äì Mobile apps that immediately translate spoken words. Google Play+1 [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?hl=en_US&id=com.erudite.translator]  Google Translate (Live Translate) ‚Äì Live speech translation into text/audio in supported languages (beta in some regions). Tom's Guide [https://www.tomsguide.com/computing/software/google-translate-is-bringing-real-time-translations-powered-by-gemini-to-your-headphones]  üìç Summary  ‚úîÔ∏è Real-time speech-to-text: Yes ‚Äî many apps and tools convert spoken language directly into written text as it‚Äôs spoken. Wikipedia [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Live_Transcribe]  ‚úîÔ∏è Real-time audio translation: Yes ‚Äî some tools also translate that speech into another language instantly. live.maestra.ai [https://live.maestra.ai/]  ‚úîÔ∏è Devices & apps vary in accuracy, languages supported, and latency.  If you want a recommendation for a specific device or app (phone/PC), let me know what platform you‚Äôre using.
sources_cited_json: [{"url":"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?hl=en_US&id=com.erudite.translator","title":"Instant Voice Translate - Apps on Google Play","description":"Voice Translation: Speak naturally and let the app provide instant translations in real-time. Communicate effortlessly and break down language barriers. 2.Read more","domain":"Google Play"},{"url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Live_Transcribe","title":"Live Transcribe","description":"","domain":"Wikipedia"},{"url":"https://speechlogger.com/","title":"Speechlogger - Real Time Speech to Text","description":"Enhance any meeting, speech or event, in-person or online, with automatic live captioning & translations. ¬∑ About Speechlogger Live Captions ¬∑ Features ¬∑ Pricing.Read more","domain":"speechlogger.com"},{"url":"https://otter.ai/","title":"Otter Meeting Agent - AI Notetaker, Transcription, Insights","description":"Otter AI Meeting Agent supports real-time transcription, live chat, automated summaries, insights, and action items.","domain":"Otter.ai"},{"url":"https://live.maestra.ai/","title":"Live Translate | Real-Time Online Voice Translator","description":"Real-time audio translation with AI voice cloning. Fast, accurate, and low-latency‚Äîavailable in 125+ languages with integrations and sharing.","domain":"live.maestra.ai"},{"url":"https://www.tomsguide.com/computing/software/google-translate-is-bringing-real-time-translations-powered-by-gemini-to-your-headphones","title":"Google Translate is bringing real-time translations powered by Gemini to your headphones","description":"December 13, 2025 ‚Äî Google has announced a major update to Google Translate that brings real-time translation powered by its AI model, Gemini, to any pair of headphones with a microphone. Previously limited to Google's Pixel Buds, this capability is now available in beta to users with the Google Translate app in the U.S., Mexico, and India. By tapping the \"Live translate\" button with headphones paired, users can access live, one-way voice translations supporting over 70 languages. This allows users to engage in conversations, listen to lectures, or watch shows in foreign languages with real-time translation delivered through their headphones.\n\nThe update also enhances text translations by leveraging AI to better understand tone, emphasis, idioms, and slang, improving naturalness and accuracy. Currently launched with support for nearly 20 languages, these improvements aim to make translation more intuitive and effective. Additionally, a new tracking feature has been introduced to monitor language learning streaks, similar to Duolingo, encouraging consistent practice. Expansion to iOS and more countries is expected in 2026.","domain":"Tom's Guide"}]
